# Language Conversion Tests
### This file was generated by tests that were run on 3/9/2017 5:41:41 AM.
# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Indexer property
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method(string str)
        {
            var item = str[3];
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	param([string]$str)
	$item = $str[3]
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Return statement
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public int Method()
        {
            return 1;
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	return 1
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Cast operator
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            var myInt = 1;
            var myLong = (long)myInt;
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	$myInt = 1
	$myLong = [long]$myInt
}
```

```csharp
namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            var variable = "1";
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell

{

}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Try, catch, finally
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            try
            {
                var item = new object();
            }
            catch (Exception ex)
            {
                var item = new object();
            }
            catch
            {
                var item = new object();
            }
            finally
            {
                var item = new object();
            }
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	try
	{
		$item = (New-Object -TypeName object)
	}
	catch [Exception]
	{
		$item = (New-Object -TypeName object)
	}
	catch
	{
		$item = (New-Object -TypeName object)
	}
	finally
	{
		$item = (New-Object -TypeName object)
	}
}
```

```csharp
namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Access the property of a variable
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class PropertyAccess
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            var timeZoneInfo = new TimeZoneInfo();
            var variable = timeZoneInfo.DisplayName;
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	$timeZoneInfo = (New-Object -TypeName TimeZoneInfo)
	$variable = $timeZoneInfo.DisplayName
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Foreach loop
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method(string[] strings)
        {
            foreach(var item in strings)
            {
                var str = item;
            }
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	param([string[]]$strings)
	foreach($item in $strings)
	{
		$str = $item
	}
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Declare a method with arguments
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method(string argument, int integer)
        {
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	param([string]$argument, [int]$integer)
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Array creation initializers
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            var arr = new string[] { "my", "strings" };
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	$arr = @("my","strings")
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Create an object
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            new System.Object();
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	(New-Object -TypeName System.Object)
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## If, Else If, Else
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            if (1 == 2)
            {

            }
            else if ("xyz" == (new Object()))
            {

            }
            else
            {

            }
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	if (1 -eq 2)
	{
	}
	elseif ("xyz" -eq ((New-Object -TypeName Object)))
	{
	}
	else
	{
	}
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Error code reported. Conversion number 50.
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
private void findButton_Click(object sender, System.EventArgs e)
{
    int index = comboBox1.FindString(textBox2.Text);
    comboBox1.SelectedIndex = index;
}
```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function findButton_Click
{
	param([object]$sender, [System.EventArgs]$e)
	[int]$index = $comboBox1.FindString($textBox2.Text)
	$comboBox1.SelectedIndex=$index
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## While loop with break
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            while (true)
            {
                break;
            }
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	while($true)
	{
		break
	}
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## For loop
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            for(int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
            {
                var t = i;
            }
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	for([int]$i = 0; $i -lt 100; $i++)
	{
		$t = $i
	}
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Create an object with arugments
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            new System.Object(myVariable);
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	(New-Object -TypeName System.Object -ArgumentList $myVariable)
}
```

# Convert CSharp to PowerShell
## Common operators
### Source: CSharp
```csharp
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;
using System.Threading.Tasks;

namespace CodeConverter.Test.Languages.CSharp
{
    public class Class
    {
        public void Method()
        {
            var eq = 1 == 2;
            var notEq = 1 != 2;
            var or = 1 == 2 || 2 == 1;
            var and = 1 == 2 && 2 == 1;
            var gt = 1 > 2;
            var lt = 1 < 2;
            var ge = 1 >= 2;
            var le = 1 <= 2;
            var plus = 1 + 1;
            var minus = 1 - 1;
            var bor = 1 | 1;
        }
    }
}

```
### Target: PowerShell
```powershell
function Method
{
	$eq = 1 -eq 2
	$notEq = 1 -ne 2
	$or = 1 -eq 2 -or 2 -eq 1
	$and = 1 -eq 2 -and 2 -eq 1
	$gt = 1 -gt 2
	$lt = 1 -lt 2
	$ge = 1 -ge 2
	$le = 1 -le 2
	$plus = 1 + 1
	$minus = 1 - 1
	$bor = 1 -bor 1
}
```
